migration:create.description: Create a new migration within your project

examples.description: Create a new migration, prompting for title and options

examples.command: <%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> "Rename field from location to address"
examples.description: Create a new migration with the provided title, prompting for options
List all available migrations in the project

migration:run.description: Run a migration against a dataset

examples.description: execute the migration against a dataset
execute the migration using a dataset export as the source

api-version.description: API version to use when migrating. Defaults to v2024-01-29.
api-version.name: api-version

concurrency.description: How many mutation requests to run in parallel. Must be between 1 and 10. Default: 6.
concurrency.name: concurrency

confirm.description: Prompt for confirmation before running the migration (default: true). Use --no-confirm to skip.
confirm.name: confirm

dataset.description: Dataset to migrate. Defaults to the dataset configured in your Sanity CLI config.
dataset.name: dataset

dry-run.description: By default the migration runs in dry mode. Use --no-dry-run to migrate dataset.
dry-run.name: dry-run

from-export.description: Use a local dataset export as source for migration instead of calling the Sanity API. Note: this is only supported for dry runs.
from-export.name: from-export

progress.description: Display progress during migration (default: true). Use --no-progress to hide output.
progress.name: progress

project.description: Project ID of the dataset to migrate. Defaults to the projectId configured in your Sanity CLI config.
project.name: project
